name: ElmHtml.ToString

aliases.name: FormatOptions
aliases.comment: Formatting options to be used for converting to string

values.name: nodeRecordToString
values.comment:
Convert a node record to a string. This basically takes the tag name, then
    pulls all the facts into tag declaration, then goes through the children and
    nests them under this one

values.name: nodeToString
values.comment: Convert a given html node to a string based on the type

values.name: nodeToStringWithOptions
values.comment: same as nodeToString, but with options

name: ElmHtml.InternalTypes

aliases.name: CustomNodeRecord
aliases.comment: Custom nodes contain facts (e.g attributes) and a json value for the model

aliases.name: Facts
aliases.comment:
Facts contain various dictionaries and values for a node
- styles are a mapping of rules
- events may be a json object containing event handlers
- attributes are pulled out into stringAttributes and boolAttributes - things with string values go into
  stringAttributes, things with bool values go into boolAttributes
aliases.type: { styles : Dict.Dict String String , events : Maybe.Maybe Json.Decode.Value , attributeNamespace : Maybe.Maybe Json.Decode.Value , stringAttributes : Dict.Dict String String , boolAttributes : Dict.Dict String Bool }

aliases.name: MarkdownNodeRecord
aliases.comment: A markdown node contains facts (e.g attributes) and the model used by markdown

aliases.name: NodeRecord
aliases.comment: A node contains the `tag` as a string, the children, the facts (e.g attributes) and descendantsCount
aliases.type: { tag : String , children : List ElmHtml.InternalTypes.ElmHtml , facts : ElmHtml.InternalTypes.Facts , descendantsCount : Int }

types.name: ElmHtml
types.comment:
Type tree for representing Elm's Html
- TextTag is just a plain old bit of text.
- NodeEntry is an actual HTML node, e.g a div
- CustomNode are nodes defined to work with the renderer in some way, e.g webgl/markdown
- MarkdownNode is just a wrapper for CustomNode designed just for markdown

values.name: decodeElmHtml
values.comment: decode a json object into ElmHtml

name: ElmHtml.Markdown

aliases.name: MarkdownModel
aliases.comment: An internal markdown model. Options are the things you give markdown, markdown is the string

aliases.name: MarkdownOptions
aliases.type: { githubFlavored : Maybe.Maybe { tables : Bool, breaks : Bool } , defaultHighlighting : Maybe.Maybe String , sanitize : Bool , smartypants : Bool }

values.name: encodeOptions
values.comment:
We don't really care about encoding options right now
TODO: we will if we want to represent things as we do for elm-html

name: ElmHtml.Constants
comment:
Constants for representing internal keys for Elm's vdom implementation

@docs styleKey, eventKey, attributeKey, attributeNamespaceKey, knownKeys

values.name: knownKeys
values.comment: Keys that we are aware of and should pay attention to
